com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue

Interface OMPModifyChargeTransactionRequestMappingUE


  • public interface OMPModifyChargeTransactionRequestMappingUE

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.w3c.dom.Document modifyChargeTransactionRequestMapping(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
      The YFSModifyCTRMappingUE user exit can be used to modify the system defined ChargeTransactionRequest mappings.

    • Method Detail

      • modifyChargeTransactionRequestMapping

        org.w3c.dom.Document modifyChargeTransactionRequestMapping(YFSEnvironment env,
                                                           org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                                                    throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSUserExitException

        The YFSModifyCTRMappingUE user exit can be used to modify the system defined ChargeTransactionRequest mappings. This is called by those APIs which have ChargeTransactionRequestList element in their Output XML. When one of the pre-conditions are met, the user exit will be invoked with

        • An element of the in memory mapping the system has preformed
        • A set of elements of all the valid, mappable components
        The system's dynamic distribution will occur first and the user exit will be invoked at the end of dynamic distribution if one of the pre-conditions are met. The user exit is called by PAYMENT_COLLECTION agent and requestCollection, processOrderPayments APIs irrespective of the output template. For other APIs like createOrder, changeOrder, getOrderDetails, createOrderInvoice, createShipmentInvoice, processOrderCollection, the user exit is called only if the output template contains ChargeTransactionRequestList element.

        To code custom user exits, implement the method in this interface. The system calls the methods in your class. If this method gives any exception, the current transaction is rolled back. The user exit implementation is responsible for timing out and retunring if any calls to an external system fail.


        Related Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Output XML Output DTD

        Pre-conditions: The user exit will be invoked if one of the following conditions are met:

        • There was an inexact match that mapped (1) an authorization or charge to a charge transaction request or (2) an authorization or open charge to an invoice
        • There was an authorization or charge that exactly matched more than one charge transaction request
        • There was an authorization or open charge that exactly matched more than one invoice
        • There was an invoice that matched more than one charge transaction requests

        Post-conditions:

        • The output of the user exit will be read into the system, replacing the mapping in the input mapping in the system
        • Any authorization not returned in the mapping will be considered as unusable by the system
        • The user exit output will not be validated for the payment configuration/rules. It should be created according to the requirement. Example: If "Allow Authorization To Exceed Settlement Request" is unchecked, then in the user exit mapping, you can still map an authorization to an invoice even if its authorization amount is more then the invoice amount.
        • It is assumed that BlindCreationAmount is passed correctly. Even if it is not passed correctly, system will create charge/authorization on the payment methods for the remaining amount


        Input Template Support: Yes It is recommended to have all necessary elements in the UE input template.

        Parameters:
        env - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API.
        inXML - Required. For more information, see the associated input xml files.


        Returns:
        An XML document containing the user defined ChargeTransactionRequest mappings. For details on the output, refer to the associated output files.


        Throws:
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSUserExitException - This exception is thrown whenever system errors that the application cannot handle are encountered. The transaction is aborted and changes are rolled back.
